com.topcoder.util.sql.databaseabstraction
Interface Converter

public interface Converter

The Converter interface defines how explicit conversion is done. In order to use the version 1.0 explicit conversion capabilities of this component, a user must create a class implementing the Converter interface, register it with a Mapper and register the Mapper with a DatabaseAbstractor.

This interface is the same with version 1.0.

This interface makes no demands on immutability or thread safety.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.1
Author:
argolite, WishingBone, aubergineanode, justforlay

Method Summary
 java.lang.Object convert(java.lang.Object value, int column, CustomResultSetMetaData metaData)
          Converts data from one type to another.
 

Method Detail

convert

public java.lang.Object convert(java.lang.Object value,
                                int column,
                                CustomResultSetMetaData metaData)
                         throws IllegalMappingException
Converts data from one type to another. The return type is defined by the implementation, as opposed to the contract for OnDemandConverter.

Parameters:
value - the original object value
column - the column the value came from
metaData - metadata for the result set
Returns:
the converted result (may be null)
Throws:
IllegalMappingException - when mapping is illegal (implementation defined - for example, invalid input)
